website_summaries.verdict: Nextbit's unlocked Robin is a decent midrange Android phone, but its novel cloud storage concept isn't seamless enough for the masses.
pros: The Nextbit Robin has a fresh, minimalist design, the latest Android software and a flawless fingerprint reader
cons: Its cloud storage solution has some execution turbulence, and battery life could be better

website_summaries.verdict: The Nextbit Robin is a beautiful unlocked Android phone with an innovative approach to cloud storage, but you need to believe in the company's vision and be willing to pay a premium for design.
pros: Automatically offloads little-used apps to the cloud
cons: Software is a bit rough around the edges
A bit expensive for the specs

customer_reviews.title: Cloud storage is great, fingerprint reader
customer_reviews.text: First off, you have to know what you're buying. This was a $150 unlocked phone not a flagship. That said I am really impressed with the style and capabilities of this phone. The OS is smooth although can lag a little at times. Cloud storage is great, fingerprint reader, NFC, etc. Great phone for the money. Definitely needs a case as it is quite slippery since it's all plastic. Unfortunately the Robin is no longer being sold as they sold to RAZR but they are updating and providing support through Feb 2018 and honoring hardware warranties through the next 6 months so if you can get your hands on one it is worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lord give me the patients to realize a cheap phone sometimes sucks.
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap phone it worked and I loved it at first but after about 9 or 10 months the phone speaker (and microphone for lack of a better term) crapped out after that. The ring tone volume started auto adjusting itself no matter how you adjusted it then got it got stuck in fastboot mode when attempting to restart via Dev degub tools. It's stuck now :( just cycling through the options. I just want to throw it at a wall or ninja kick it at this point. P.S. Also attempted to remove the battery but it's got a screw that my even my tiniest Phillips can't handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kell_Phx

customer_reviews.title: ... before I bought my last iPhone and I really liked the concept of having a lot of cloud storage
customer_reviews.text: I had looked at this phone before I bought my last iPhone and I really liked the concept of having a lot of cloud storage. My iPhone went for a swim so I thought I'd give the Robin a try, after a month, I noticed many glitches, after less than 3 months, the phone bricked, I was sending an email and the battery was at 90% and it just shot off, never to come back on again. Not stoked that I bought a phone that lasted less than 90 days. Steer clear of this garbage, the company is out of business so there is no support.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Get the protection plan if you buy
customer_reviews.text: I liked this phone a lot at first. I love the space, however there are some problems. I got two phones. One for me and one for s/o. His stopped working in less than a month. No broken screen or anything it just stopped. And both phone have issues while on the phone of going mute. People on the other end cannot hear you even though you can hear them, without the mute button hit. You have to hang up and call again. I should have gotten the protection plan obviously but I didn't expect it to have these problems especially so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kjk

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to handle!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is nice. Feels nice in the hand. And, at this time, it's inexpensive (snagged mine for 129.99, Robin Blue). I've knocked a star off for the heat. This thing is a hand warmer, that's for sure. But, it is fast, and reliable, and open to the community (the XDA on this thing is off the charts). I highly recommend picking one up. It's a lovely little phone with a nice screen, good speed, plenty of ram, and NFC (So many phones in this bracket don't bother with it). Keep in mind: Hot, no OTG, you need to be conservative with the battery life (I've never noticed a problem).
customer_reviews.author: Tobwa

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement phone. Almost stock Android. Nice design. Decent camera. Got the update to 7.1.1 right after I started the phone. Required micro SIM to work. Notification light is placed next to the charging cable. That is a stupid decision. It's hard to spot it from far. Speaker is not powerful. Notifications can be heard only when the sound is close to max. Power button is too thin. It's difficult to find it. Bluetooth has some issues. It turns itself off regularly. I wish it had double tap to wake.
customer_reviews.author: Ashwin Mudigonda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone at the current price point if and only if you use a custom rom!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is well designed. The quick charge ability is fast from 20% to full charge in 30/40 minutes. The key of any carrier unlocked gsm phone is the supported radio bands. This phone works on ANY gsm mvno in the US . UPDATE... I rooted the Robin and installed AICP Android 7.1.2, much improvement. The screen is brighter, all bugs in the software are history and the battery life improved by 10 percent.
customer_reviews.author: The Delivery Man doesn't knock or ring! Track it!

customer_reviews.title: Works - just long enough to be out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: As a phone, it's great. No problem. It works. It looks nice. But this is the second unit. The first one gave up in a week. Headphone problems. When listening with phones, it suddenly cuts out and plays from speakers. Yes, I've tried all kinds of other buds and phones. The replacement worked longer than a week. Hallelujah! But it displayed the exact same problem 34 days into a 30 day warranty. Now we're stuck with this half-jacked phone. They may have found a fix, but they haven't told us.
customer_reviews.author: larry s

customer_reviews.title: This is the best prepaid phone I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase phones almost strictly based off ratings. Saw this phone, and immediately jumped on board. The Nextbit Robin is an incredibly lightweight, but reasonably sturdy phone. It has an intriguing ultra slim design, with sharp corners and a sleek look overall. The start up process for the phone was relatively simple.. required a couple updates but nothing that took too long (total setup time about 30 minutes). Offered all the basics for a customized phone (Google accounts, security features, location settings, etc). This is the first Nextbit Robin I have owned, and since having it I have absolutely recommended it to those looking for an inexpensive prepaid phone. (Currently used on T-Mobile)
customer_reviews.author: Lobotomy_brat

customer_reviews.title: What would be a good phone for the money falls short due to manufacturer flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone on Jan 12, 2017.. I returned it Feb 9, 2017. When I first got the phone.. it was fast, unique, really liked the phone. It's alot more durable then most make it out to be and unless your bending it in half its rigid enough for everyday use. My problem started maybe two weeks in. The front speakers went out. No sound except on calls or through Bluetooth. Couldn't hear ringtone or alarms. Nothing. After many tries with customer service to fix situation it was returned. Overall what could have been a really good phone failed the test all together in less than a month. Hopefully their next phone is better.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Garbin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome unique phone.
customer_reviews.text: Damn awesome phone. Everything works perfectly on T-Mobile / MetroPCS. Popped in sim and called imei in. Phone got LTE right away with no configuration needed. Fast data and even MMS message works out of the box. Perfectly new sealed device. Highly recommend if you are like me and long to use a unique and stylish device that is rocket fast and updates to Android nougat. Excellent. I will be buying another as a backup soon. BTW gets band 12 for T-Mobile
customer_reviews.author: N. Cirillo

customer_reviews.title: Works with LineageOS
customer_reviews.text: Best reasonably priced phone that works with LineageOS to upgrade to the version based on Android 7.1. Hoping Android 8.1 version of LineageOS will be available for this phone too. I really like the front facing speakers, but have to admit the overall shape and size of the phone is hard to hold onto. I don't drop it, but it really feels like I will. This phone is fast enough and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Colin K.

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about that Nextbit
customer_reviews.text: This phone is awesome I'm coming from a Samsung Galaxy S5 which was okay but was getting long in the tooth I picked up the nextbit robin and can't put it down front facing stereo speakers 100 GB of cloud storage 32 on board support T-Mobile Wi-Fi calling and great reception on 4G LTE can't wait for the Android nougat update pick this phone up you won't go wrong I'm have the mint colored one myself
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great with T-Mobile service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone for the money. I was previously using a Samsung J3 (possibly the worst phone ever made), and this phone is such a massive upgrade from that one. Very fast and smooth, no glitches, every app I want to use works great. Battery life is solid, and the screen is nice and bright. Speakers are loud too! What else can you ask for? Gets comments every time I pull it out of my pocket. Awesome device.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: It is has a great hand-feel. It doesn't feel like it's going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Really liking this phone. It is has a great hand-feel. It doesn't feel like it's going to fall or slip out of my hand. The screen is nice, but does wash out in direct sunlight. The OS is really smooth and fast. The only non-stock Android apps are the launcher (due to the backup functionality), the camera and the gallery (both of which are far nicer than their stock counterparts).
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Heiselman

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone for $129 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Great little phone... Using it as main phone for almost 4 weeks.... I don't play games - I read newspaper, kindle, Google news, watch youtube, netflix, installed 10+ hotel / airline booking app, 10+ banks apps, use andriod pay - the phone never once slow down ... Took one straight off for terrible battery life & phone gets pretty hot after some continue use for 45min to an hour.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Wow I really like this phone was unsure in buying this phone at first because of the whole Razer buying Nextbit thing but I'm glad I got it. Overall very nice quality, updated to nougat without a problem Android is almost stock without bloatware. I say for the price you can't get a better phone. I'm very satisfied with this awesome phone.
customer_reviews.author: Erik S.Top Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: For the price this phone is great!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this phone is great! I bought this phone since my Nexus 5x broke to hold me over for the 2 weeks that LG needed to repair it. For $118 it was the best option! While i had to wait a while for the phone to update to get it to Android 7.1.1 the phone is pretty comparable to my broken Nexus. the Nextbit home app takes a little getting use to but you can easily change it with a new launcher (though not sure how i would access archived apps). Thinking about buying 1 more as a backup!
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: It is not perfect but it has a special feature that everyone needs
customer_reviews.text: It is not perfect but it has a special feature that everyone needs...more available memory. I can't believe that not more people are picking this thing up because of this. I hate to see this thing get discounted from $300 to $150 which suggests that sales aren't going well, but that should be great news for anyone looking for a budget phone because this is totally worth it. Before I would have never even trying to get a phone with NFC or a finger print scanner but both are great features along with the extra memory. I love it and I am glad that I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson

customer_reviews.title: My Robin died and Dealfisher saved the day.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Nextbit Robin on August 30, 2017 it failed on November 4, 2017. It has white vertical lines across the screen and is unresponsive. It will not Shutdown or Reboot. I did the power button and low volume button and did a factory reset. It still has the lines and is unresponsive. Sucks. But, I contacted seller Dealfisher and they promptly made arrangements to replace the phone. Thanks. I will definitely purchase again from Amazon and Dealfisher.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbobrvc

customer_reviews.title: power key not functioning, MMS is of VERY LOW quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone after BLU. I paid twice as much and I got no more than half the quality of BLU. They turned of the cloud, it gets hot when talking more than 10 minutes, photos sent via MMS become of very poor quality, power key works in 1 out of 100 cases after less than a year of use. I am disappointed, this is the worst phone I have ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Nino D.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my older son and one for my wife. Screen size, color and brightness is excellent. Battery life is good, but as you all should know mobile battery consumption depends heavily on provider's antennas disposition. Also important, since is unlocked, each one are on different providers. No problem there. Storage capacity is great, a least it's been a while since last complain about space due to pictures and videos! True.. the cloud thing is just for apps. For what you get, price is fair.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Briceno Febres

customer_reviews.title: Shortened my lifespan by at least 5 years
customer_reviews.text: If this phone had cost me the original 400 dollars I would've given it a one star. But it really earned that extra star for being down to 120. I expected it to be at least two thirds as functional as my Nexus 5x, especially considering that it was more expensive at launch, and technically has slightly better specs. I was disappointed to say the least. Don't expect the fingerprint reader to work properly more than 1 in 20 times. But who cares, it's two years old and was already obsolete by the time it came out. Big money out.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Industrial Design of its year
customer_reviews.text: I love the industrial design of this phone and the dual front facing speakers. I did not take advantage of the Cloud feature and this was a fill-in between the almost death of my Nexus 5 and the acquisition of my Pixel XL. Smooth, relatively fast. I now use it as my streaming device to Chromecast and a bluetooth speaker and it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. It's odd & unique in today's market. I'm not sure exactly why Nextbit couldn't make it as a company but this phone is nice. I'm using it as a backup for my main phone but it's pretty snappy and I like the styling and colors. It also has two front facing speakers which is something I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Phone. Better Company.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone, and I'm really sad to hear that Razer is killing support for it. Thank you to the team that made this, and gave the mobile world something different for once. I hope under Razer, the team will continue to make phones of this caliber.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter James

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great battery life i am use 8am ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phone,great battery life i am use 8am to 8pm whith no problem to life battery,very fast to internet in 4G an Wifi,great song volume and very very fast charge to anker 3.0 quick charge,full charge with phone turn on in 1h 30 min Only dont like the interface its to burry but the solution its izzy launcher app
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with Caution
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this phone. I was the owner of a Nexus 5x which conked on me after a year plus. After a back and forth with Google, I decided to get the next bit as it was touted as the closest thing to the Nexus which I really loved. The phone itself is pretty nifty and I was excited because it reminded me of my old phone.... except that within a month the top speaker stopped working.... WITHIN a month...not to mention that the sound from them is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: The phone came to me with faults, I made the claim and they did not refund me. I used it with faults until recently. The battery has swollen and caused the screen to come off. I lost my money when I bought this Nextbit Robin. I DON'T recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Jhon P.

customer_reviews.title: This phone did not age well
customer_reviews.text: I picked this phone up on June 4, 2017 and it is complete garbage now. Battery life is horrible, I have some dead pixels on the bottom right of my screen and its so laggy and slow. Please dont buy this abandoned( I mean by the company, no more support/no updates) phone, its good for a few months but throw it away after that.
customer_reviews.author: Bench

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I knew there were going to be a few issues but it was basically unusable. IT. WAS. SLOW. Unbearably slow. Nothing would load. Nothing would download. It has 3 gigs of ram it has NO excuse to be this slow. Everything else is solid the build, the speakers, the screen, even the camera which is an otherwise common complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in the Carolinas

customer_reviews.title: flimsy cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: Phone works pretty well but the screen cracked after only two weeks! I bought a protective screen cover and hard case for it. It was knocked off a desk and fell 3 ft to the floor and that's all it took for the screen to crack. Hoping the warranty covers this, really disappointed in the construction of this thing. wow.
customer_reviews.author: matt blanks

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I purchased this for under $200 unlocked and it is a great phone. Nextbit handles memory issues by utilizing the cloud, which allows plenty of room for apps. The phone looks and feels good, the only issue I have is the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly happy
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best, most interesting phone I've ever owned. I've owned Samsung, iPhone and many others, but this phone is awesome. I don't understand some of the negative reviews. Maybe I just got the best one they made.
customer_reviews.author: dorakpurvis

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone for $125
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone for $125, but it has lost support and the skin Nextbit has put over it with seems dates. Wish it was just stock Android out of the box. Sold it a month later. Also seemed a bit fragile, especially with no extensive after market cases like an otterbox.
customer_reviews.author: LifeCast

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery, no more support and not a good choice anymore
customer_reviews.text: First impression:For 120 dollars, this is an amazing phone. Thanks to razer the cloud storage is gone, but at least the price is now a good thing. Now: it's been a year and thenhone glitches like crazy, battery life terrible and pretty unuseable now.
customer_reviews.author: Taposi Halder

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Phone stopped working completely in less 60 days after purchasing. Not cool and no refund. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the freedom of customization and I love how my ...
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of reviews complaining about the way it is set up and how the widgets are located ect. But the thing about this phone is it was made to be customized. I use a launcher app and customize my icons and setup to make it look the way I want. I love the freedom of customization and I love how my apps are sent to the cloud when not in use. I've been having so much fun making this phone my own and it runs so well. This is my first Android after switching from iPhone and I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT piece of gear, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 13 year career techie who was millimeters from becoming a flip phone guy again. Unlocked hardware with respectable specs, stock Android with no carrier / manufacturer / "random brother-in-law of a major stockholder" bloatware to eat up processing power, crisp, clean design in both HW and SW, and finally, FINALLY a stake through the heart of the "Insufficient Space" glitch that Google should be ashamed still exists... Wow. I was a bit skeptical, having been burned by other HW in this price range, but after a month behind the wheel, I'd buy it again at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this phone
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this phone. It works amazing and the updates allowed for a smooth and organised function of the phone. Everyone who has seen this phone loved the colour and the design. I bought two others for my parents who immediately wanted the phone as soon as I unboxed it. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kavita

customer_reviews.title: So far seems to be a good phone, quick and responsive
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to be a good phone, quick and responsive, Turn on and updates to 7.1.1, launcher easy replaced for a better more functional like nova, standard apps, no bloatware, have not tested camera too much but seems good so far. Price was too good to skip.
customer_reviews.author: joefox

customer_reviews.title: Phone is good. Nextbit, well, not too happy with
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone. Snappy, feels great ergonomically. Love the fast charging. Charging cable has crack in connector that I am not happy with. Notified Nextbit and they called it physical damage, which I can promise I did not cause. It's more of a stress crack. Anyway, they refused replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brad75204

customer_reviews.title: Great phone amazing price !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect phone for me. Really fast, the camera is great, almost like my iPhone 6 except it struggles with dark light and it can be blurry if you move while taking pictures. I had iPhones for 10 years and I decided to switch to Android because my iPhone 6 went really slow after the kids 11 update. Also I'm living in France and Robin works perfectly here. Note that the Nextbit servers will shut down in March 2018 so it won't be able to save your data to the cloud anymore. But honestly it's working way better than my iPhone 6, and I only paid 115$ for it, hard to believe !
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Junior

customer_reviews.title: The phone is pretty. I guess that's about all the positives I ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone is pretty. I guess that's about all the positives I can think of by this point. I bought it in June 2017.... Now in February 2018, not even a full year later, the power button somehow broke and the fingerprint scanner failed. Turning it on is a fiasco and it's overall a nightmare using this phone. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last!
customer_reviews.text: Phone is great for about 3 months then stops charging. This was my second one. They last too long to return which is the worst part.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Best value Android phone, period.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is the best purchase I could have made. Very snappy, even with a dozen apps open. My previous phone was the LG V10, and this device outperforms that at a fraction of the cost. The team at Nextbit did a great job at optimizing this device for performance.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: One of the best.
customer_reviews.text: So much space I love this phone people go crazy over the colors and always ask about the phone. I will be buying another for family member who is always having to delete things for space on their phone. The only concern is charging, it takes a while to charge, not rediculously long but turning on hotspot kills it faster than most phones I've had. But i can't help to think it could be my charger. Will update when I find out
customer_reviews.author: jenique wilson

customer_reviews.title: great phone and great deal
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have had our next bit Robin phone for about two weeks. We love the ohone. Super thin. Great camera. Lots of memory. Android. I think my on lily complaint is that I miss my Samsung icons. Pretty minimal complaint
customer_reviews.author: J. Campagna

customer_reviews.title: Problems w using Robin outside of US
customer_reviews.text: This phone has been great in the US but hasn't worked overseas. I use T-Mobile and the phone works perfectly in California. But, when traveling in Mexico, Iceland and Denmark, data does not work with T-Mobile, even though it should. Days works on my wife's HTC and my son's cheap smartphone. I have spoken w T-Mobile about it, with local phone companies to try and resolve the problem but no luck. Since it has occurred in the straight countries, I am certain the problem is the phone. I have spoken w Robin support about it but they say the issue is w the cellular network.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: It has network interference that makes it stop working at a time turns off on its own.
customer_reviews.text: It started switching off on itself , sometimes it took time to power and finally turned off and never power again. but it charges and never power on . It has network interference that makes it stop working at a time turns off on its own. but now mine doesn't turn on . can i return it for repair or swap in ?
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This phone has honestly been the best purchase I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: This phone has honestly been the best purchase I have ever made. I work in a heavily dusty work place and for the price this phone with stands the test of time. Not to mention I get asked if this phone is a Nextbit Robin by name from time to time and it opens all sorts of conversation doors. A lot of people don't know what it is and ask about it. I hope they produce a better phone with better camera for a comparable price. The one I'm on now is at it's witts end and I wish I had another. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan P.

customer_reviews.title: ... phone one last system updates to Nougat which is nice. Solid phone
customer_reviews.text: Nextbit will be cutting off their service soon but Razer was kind enough to give the phone one last system updates to Nougat which is nice. Solid phone, solid camera. There's a few issues that I have but for almost 200 bucks off retail and considering the age it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Faries

customer_reviews.title: very upset with company
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone around a year ago with a 1 year warranty. When it started having trouble with the OS I tried filing for a warranty issues, however the company said that the issue was to be dealt with by the manufacturer. Since nextbit was acquired another company, this new company is not honoring warranty agreements. The phone was really great while it lasted, however it remains incredibly dishonest as they will not honor any sort of warranty now.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It is not worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Robin Warranty Support Has Ended. Problems with the battery, spare parts no. If you want a device that will be on the shelf it's your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Anatoliy

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm
customer_reviews.text: Love the phone and the way it worked but is really flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Norse

customer_reviews.title: Great phone! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great phone! Love it! I came from an Iphone, its a cool company and a way good phone for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Findlay

customer_reviews.title: The looked nice. It didn't load when we turned it on
customer_reviews.text: The looked nice. It didn't load when we turned it on. We tried multiple times and ended up returning it. The customer service team was very helpful when we contacted them.
customer_reviews.author: V Patel

customer_reviews.title: Great phone but what I received was a phone with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phone but what I received was a phone with a blacklisted IMEI number, tried with multiple GSM carriers, no luck. Was told by carrier representatives that it could not be used at all.
customer_reviews.author: mad.decent

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if potential microphone malfunction.
customer_reviews.text: After several hours of using the Robin phone callers could not here my voice. Dissapointed in the phone. Talked to technical support they determined it was a hardware problem. After reading several reviews... This seems to be a common problem. Would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Donelson

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this phone
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this phone. It's an extreme bargain for a phenomenal device. Literally my only complaint is that the second one I ordered to replace my first one had a defective sim card drawer. Luckily I had a spare, otherwise I would've had to deal with the runaround of a return before I could get back to using my beloved Nextbit Robin!
customer_reviews.author: dakotah

customer_reviews.title: I keep getting compliments how great the picture quality is
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my purchase, I keep getting compliments how great the picture quality is. I did get a bad comment about it being slow when I tried to get some song from another phone via Bluetooth. I am not sure how much of a protection the case i bought with the phone will offer, I am hoping it is durable and indeed protective. Otherwise I am good, i love the phone and especially excited about the storage space☺️
customer_reviews.author: Trevina White

customer_reviews.title: This phone of mine has issues
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw this phone it was on kickstart for over $500 so when I came across it again on here I was excited. After having it for a little over a month the excitement has gone away. The phone freezes, doesn't always show who's calling, and my texts get sent to the recipient late. I'd love to return it but that's not an option so I'm gonna buy a different brand and hope it sorks
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jones

customer_reviews.title: cool but for short time
customer_reviews.text: very cool color and shape, fast and easy to use, but I started to have issues with the buttons after using it for 5 months only, and I had to get another phone after 6 months because the on/off button wasn’t a working properly.
customer_reviews.author: samar al masraf

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Smartphone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone. Unlocked for all GSM networks. Fast LTE, fast CPU, awesome sound, very comfortable and light in hand. Very nice color, and stands out in the crowd. The finger print sensor works very quick 99% of the time. Great device for enjoying multimedia. One thing I don't like is that the price varied around $30 dollars within a week and Amazon isn't responding to that.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone, takes great pictures, very loud speaker. Takes a little getting use to the layout but overall extremely user friendly
customer_reviews.author: CourtneyAdkins

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone looking for an unlocked phone
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth the price! Did a lot of research and there is nothing out there that can beat these specs for this price. UI is fast and no bloatware. Been using it for several months now and still loving it. Would recommend to anyone looking for an unlocked phone.
customer_reviews.author: Seth-WhiteFox

customer_reviews.title: Very dim screen
customer_reviews.text: Product was returned It has the specs, but could not get past the dim screen. Being used to Samsung, Sony, and Asus phones, the Robin only goes to about 85% brightness of other phones at 100% brightness. If you will always be in low-light settings this phone would not be that bad.
customer_reviews.author: SHAWN MERROW

customer_reviews.title: GREAT phone!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT phone!! My daughter absolutely LOVES it!! Her only complaint is that the volume isn't as loud as most phones but, for its many positive features, she is willing to look past that!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Soooooo glad I bought this!!! No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: Best phone EVER. If you are thinking of buying it DO IT. Great phone for the price don't regret getting rid of my iPhone. Not to mention it's a fraction of the price people are paying for smartphones and this is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Budget Phone
customer_reviews.text: Good phone for a great price. Have had some bugs but this is natural for a small company. Battery life is above average, but I still find myself charging it during the day. The phone can get quite hot at times so beware. Note: This phone was discontinued by the seller (but will continue receive software support for at least 6 months)
customer_reviews.author: WANT SOME SPRITE?

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Phone is fast and feels good in the hand. LED is not located on the face, but on the bottom so message notification is different. Interface is nice and clean. Cloud storage looks like it could be good, but no idea how long it will last. For the price, this was an excellent phone.
customer_reviews.author: Silgel

customer_reviews.title: First day worked fine, second day started having problems turning it on
customer_reviews.text: First day worked fine, second day started having problems turning it on. It took me 10 minutes to turn it on one time before I finally gave up on the phone entirely. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra H

customer_reviews.title: Price, value, performance
customer_reviews.text: Unlocked and very easy to set up. Wish it had expandable memory other than that really enjoyed phone and have received many compliments on it
customer_reviews.author: mike blankenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and after a year of use I was informed that the battery is dead and there are no replacement for it on the market making the phone officially dead, what a waist for perfectly good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Khachba

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: battery doesnt last enough besides gets hot all the time
customer_reviews.author: jmrhrrr

customer_reviews.title: Constantly turns off randomly
customer_reviews.text: Phone is in good condition, works and functions perfectly fine, but after two months of use has begun to shut down randomly, sometimes when I'm in the middle of doing something, other times when it is locked and not doing anything Does this up to 10 times a day now, rather annoying
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for $150
customer_reviews.text: Best experience for $164. Worth every penny highly recommended for anyone that interested in buying a budget phone. (Although this isnt a budget phone because specs are up to the par) camera is good. As soon as my 1st boot got the latest android nought update. Highly recommended. Snappy. Overall 10/10 for me as a long time apple user im satisfied. #NextbitBestInBusiness
customer_reviews.author: Dhanuka Peeris

customer_reviews.title: stop working for any reason
customer_reviews.text: i got this phone on december. and 2 days ago it started missbehaving, suddenly rebooting and then it just turned off for no reason. i can turn it on since that momment, wath means i have no phone.
customer_reviews.author: willmi

customer_reviews.title: Needs better camera, good phone otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: Camera isn't as good as we'd like, otherwise very nice, bloatware free, fast, cheap phone! Everyone is intrigued by its look and asks about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid ($130) this is an incredible phone. I purchased this after I lost my OnePlus 3 (a $429 phone) and found myself needing a new phone during a tight financial period... The only things I really miss from it are the metal build and the camera quality. The Nextbit Robin is just as nice to use in pretty much every other way.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chaples

customer_reviews.title: Support has ENDED
customer_reviews.text: Support for this phone's BEST feature, the cloud, has been disabled. Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Ouzter

customer_reviews.title: no regrets. buy 2. upgrade. store one
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in little less than 48 hrs. Best phone for the money. Dont believe the negative reviews. Works great with att. 4g LTE. Wifi works great. Tethering works great. No regrets
customer_reviews.author: ryan pitaroll

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: Was a great phone only problem was the battery was way too small for the phone to be useful.had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Logston

customer_reviews.title: Very good phone for the budget price but battery seems to ...
customer_reviews.text: From the first time since I turned on this phone this is used to be dead for no reason.I have to charge this phone to turn it back on and this happened me twice the very first day.I did all the trouble shooting steps which was mentioned in the Nextbit website but it didn't work. So I decided to return it.Very good phone for the budget price but battery seems to be an issue
customer_reviews.author: Abhi Bhat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone for the price. I really was hoping a second Robin will come out... I guess we can wait and see what Razer has up their sleeves. For a phone that is significantly cheaper than normal, we got our Nougat update just like other brands which makes me feel loved by our Razer overlords.
customer_reviews.author: Hsueh Lin Chen

customer_reviews.title: good product for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, its a pretty good phone, takes decent pictures, finger print scanner works well. After about a year and a half of owning it the power button was cutting out and i had to get a new phone, but i got a lot of use from it. Also bends fairly easy if your super rough on it so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: I dropped the phone once and the keypad stopped working. The phone is made of a cheap material and would not recommend. I had to get a new phone within six months.
customer_reviews.author: Samrachana Adhikari

customer_reviews.title: The phone is amazing only one problem it gets hot very fast just ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone is amazing only one problem it gets hot very fast just from light usage I can feel it even with a case on and sometimes gets unfortable especially when charging and using it hope an update fixes that
customer_reviews.author: justin martinez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the phone very much. Worth for the money. Camera is good. No concerns as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Madhu

customer_reviews.title: but this is a great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: I know it's quickly going out of service with the manufacturer, but this is a great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer E. Halsey

customer_reviews.title: lcd is good!! but too big size for me
customer_reviews.text: fast and thin! lcd is good!! but too big size for me. I like 4 inch lcd.
customer_reviews.author: JackJack

customer_reviews.title: Great for an unlocked phone
customer_reviews.text: To keep this short, the phone itself is excellent for what I need it for and it is honestly a good food if you need something cheap but better than most with this budget. I was most surprised by the camera and even though I've heard of shutter lag I have not experienced it myself, all in all I would get this phone again.
customer_reviews.author: Pia Madoki

customer_reviews.title: All good, but it is annoying that they do not ...
customer_reviews.text: All good, but it is annoying that they do not pack the charging block. WE have to order it separately.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Cozzani

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware configuration at a super low affordable price !!
customer_reviews.text: This device does all what a phone is expected of, on a day to day schedule. - Hexacore processor - 3 GB RAM Grab one till you can.... !!
customer_reviews.author: SamSails

customer_reviews.title: Great mid range phone at bargain basement price
customer_reviews.text: Great mid range phone at bargain basement price. Updated to Nougat 7.1.1. Battery is good--was concerned due to certain reviews, but no issues, same with the finger print sensor. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: chris wilding

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone! I'm so happy with my purchase. The phone is elegant and the user interface is beautiful. I feel like I received lots of Value for my money. I was always a Android user and my previous phone was the Lenovo K3 Note. This Robin is light years better than that phone. Enjoy! Thanks for a great phone NextBit
customer_reviews.author: aleksandar stupar

customer_reviews.title: Unfinished phone
customer_reviews.text: Went through two of these phones within a year. First one warped and the screen had a major software glitch that would make it distort. Customer service was very odd. After many emails back and forth they agreed to send me a new phone after I sent mine in. A little more than a month later, I received my new phone. This phone has also warped and the microphone no longer works during calls or voicemails recording. It's another software issue. Other apps like a guitar tuner and a DB measuring app do pick up sound. I do not recommend this phone as it seems it is still in development.
customer_reviews.author: GarrettLee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any regrets getting this phone. I didn't like the launcher that comes with it but that can be replaced with using the Nova launcher. It's super fast and I love the look of it. The only thing that I'm disspointed with is they sent me the wrong color. I wanted to get the mint version and they sent me the midnight one.
customer_reviews.author: Jgray

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's been a good phone so far. I've been using it heavily and it has had no problem, but... It has a terrible problem where it pauses your music automatically when you're using an auxiliary cable. It's very annoying and happens maybe 20 times in 3 minutes. Works fine with Bluetooth though. But thats a big problem so it detracts a lot if you're a big music listener like me. The build quality is very good, nice materials used. And the screen is great, high res. The tactile feedback is very good. And the packaging is excellent. The buttons are also nice. And the cameras are great, fast and great looking.
customer_reviews.author: ♥ichigo♥

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: Good phone for the price. Amazing design. Absolutely no problems with the phone at all
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

product_meta.title: Nextbit Robin Factory Unlocked GSM Smartphone - Midnight
product_meta.description:
Color:Midnight Black

Meet Robin, the First Android phone that makes running out of space history. With the cloud integrated into Android OS, your onboard storage is merged with the cloud, so you always have the space you need. Robin seamlessly backs up your apps and photos, intelligently archives the stuff you're not using, and easily restores items when you need them. Robin is designed to Stand out. It's simple and distinct in form and function: every port, button, and sensor is thoughtfully placed and easy to use. For example, why have two buttons when one makes more sense? press the power button, leave your finger there for a Split second, and Robin is unlocked. It's simple, the power button is a fingerprint sensor too. 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

$1,362,343 raised with 3,611 backers. 


Every Detail Matters Everything about the design is carefully planned to create harmony and balance. Square sides make Robin easy to grip while gently rounded edges are comfortable in your hand. Robin’s weight is balanced so it always stays centered in your palm. 

Room to Grow By merging the cloud and onboard storage, Robin seamlessly backs up your apps and photos, intelligently archives the stuff you’re not using, and easily restores items when you need them.




Thinking Ahead Months before you ever run out of storage, Robin anticipates you’ll need more space and continually syncs your apps and photos.

Gone but Not Lost When you need space, Robin archives the things you use least, so you always have space for what you want most. 

Back in a Flash In just a click any app restores just where you left off. The same is true for every photo you’ve ever taken.




Don’t Just Take Our Word "Robin is a fantastic phone for someone who wants something that’s unique and well-designed, someone who takes a ton of photos, and/or someone who loves playing a lot of mobile games (and doesn’t want to delete anything to make room for more.)” - Nicole Nguyen, Buzzfeed. “I really think the Robin has enough style and familiarity to be the tempting force that moves some lifelong iOS users towards an affair with Android.” - Lucas Matney, TechCrunch. “The Nextbit Robin delivers a different, yet familiar smartphone experience. The outside is unlike almost anything you’ll likely see on the street today.” - Samuel Gibbs, The Guardian.




About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.

You’ll stand out

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

We got fed up. We had all been in the smartphone world since the early days, and we missed the feeling of excitement and innovation. Instead of originality and big changes, everyone has been copying features and phone designs from each other the past few years. Everything is incremental now, but there is so much more that can be done. Big things. So we designed the Nextbit OS to take Android to the next level and show the possibilities of a cloud connected future. And we designed Robin as a phone that would stand out from the crowd.

¶ What makes your product special?

You don’t run out of storage. By merging cloud and onboard storage, Robin seamlessly backs up your apps and photos. When you need space it intelligently archives the stuff you’re not using. And if you ever want anything back you can easily restore items when you need them. Robin does this all automatically, so you never have to worry. And Robin does this in a way that won’t drain your battery or eat up your wireless data. Plus, it looks pretty great.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

What people say when they see Robin, not just back on Kickstarter, but now every day in people’s hands has blown us away. We set out to build a phone that we’d be proud to use, something that wasn’t just great software or specs, but truly different design. Being a startup means we didn’t have to make the usual compromises that older brands face. We could take a new path. Everyday we get to come to work knowing we’re making a cooler future for ourselves and our fellow users.
feature_bullets: GSM Version (for AT&T and TMobile networks in the US; best choice for all international backers including Canada)
100 GB online Screen: 5.2” IPS LCD 1080p, Gorilla Glass 4
13MP with phase detection autofocus, dual tone flash Front camera: 5MP Battery: 2680 mAh Dual front facing stereo speakers Fingerprint sensor NFC Quick charging Bluetooth 4.0 LE WiFi A/B/G/N/AC
